content.question: A spring-loaded toy is launched straight upward from the surface of a table. In Case <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the toy is caught at the instant that it reaches its highest point and held at rest. In Case <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the toy is allowed to rise, then fall back to the table. In which case is the magnitude of the average velocity of the toyâ€™s free-fall motion the greatest?

choices.label: Case <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because the toy travels for less time
Case <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because the toy has a greater displacement
Case <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the toy travels a greater distance
Case <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, because the toy travels for a longer time

content.answer: Case <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, because the toy has a greater displacement
